Text: Paul Pierce finished with a game-high 26 points, as the Boston Celtics took control in the second half and held off the Golden State Warriors with a 94-86 win. Jeff Green scored of his 10 of 18 points in the fourth quarter for Boston, as they overcame 17 turnovers and won their eighth straight game at the TD Garden. Stephen Curry had 25 points for the visitors, but struggled through a miserable shooting night (6-for-22) and his teammates could not pick up the slack offensively. The Warriors have now dropped three straight games overall, and nine of their last 12.
